intro: Iodanthus striatus, commonly known as the narrowleaf iodanthus, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. Iodanthus striatus is often found in the eastern and central United States, where it plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
